data.name: web_search
data.description: Search the web for up-to-date information, news, and facts.

query.description: Search query string describing what to look up.

recency_days.description: How many days back to prioritize in the search (e.g. 1 = last 24h, 7 = last week).

max_results.description: Maximum number of search results to return.

data.name: file_search
data.description: Search user-provided documents or vector stores to retrieve relevant passages.

query.description: Query string describing what information to retrieve from the files.

top_k.description: Maximum number of chunks or documents to return.

include_metadata.description: Whether to return document metadata (file names, ids, etc.).

data.name: image_generation
data.description: Generate images from natural language prompts using the images API.

prompt.description: Detailed description of the image to generate.

data.name: code_interpreter
data.description: Execute small code snippets (e.g. Python) for calculations, data inspection, and plotting.

stdin.description: Optional standard input for the process.

data.name: mcp_connector
data.description: Call an MCP connector/server and invoke one of its tools.

server.description: The MCP server or connector name to call.

tool.description: Tool name on the MCP server to invoke.

arguments.description: JSON object of arguments to pass to the selected tool.

data.name: apply_patch
data.description: Apply structured patches to JSON or text documents (for example, configuration updates).

target.description: Identifier of the target document or resource to patch.

patch.description: Patch payload describing the changes to apply.

patch_type.description: Type of patch to apply (e.g. json_merge, json_patch, text_replace).

data.name: shell
data.description: Execute shell commands in a controlled environment.

timeout_seconds.description: Maximum time in seconds to allow the command to run.

working_directory.description: Optional working directory for the command.

data.name: retrieval
data.description: High-level retrieval wrapper to fetch and synthesize information from multiple sources (files, vector stores, connectors).

query.description: Natural language query describing the information to retrieve.

sources.description: List of logical sources to search over (e.g. ['files', 'web', 'mcp']).

max_items.description: Maximum number of items to aggregate.

data.name: computer_use
data.description: Plan and issue high-level computer control actions (for example, open an app, click a button, type text).

target.description: The target element or application when applicable.

details.description: Additional structured parameters for the action.

data.name: local_shell
data.description: Run shell commands against the local project environment (for example, git status, pytest).

command.description: Command to run inside the local project workspace.
